chargeHist.descr: Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor B. Gruetzmacher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Trevor B. Gruetzmacher is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Trevor B. Gruetzmacher was found guilty of Knowingly Operating While Suspended (Cause Great Bodily Harm), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bond applied - see restitution summary.
Court orders victim to be paid before the insurance company.
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or education or a combination equal to full time.

Defendant shall have no contact directly or indirectly with Steven Inger.
Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle on public roads without a valid license and permission of the Agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall possess prescription medication only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.
Defendant shall obtain prescriptions from one pharmacy and notify Agent within 72 hours of any new or changing prescriptions.
Defendant shall comply with all Mental Health evaluations, treatment and programming.
Defendant shall complete a cognitive intervention program.
Credit for 4 days, if probation is revoked.
Defendant shall complete an AODA assessment and comply with all required treatment.
